intro: Thibaudia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
